title: Family Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews over several days. The questions were very difficult to answer and there was a long onboarding process up to one month before starting work. They could improve this system.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had an issue with upper management and how did you handle it?

title: Behavioral Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Easterseals (Woodbridge, VA)
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer calls via zoom. It is about 30 minutes. The interview consists of questions regarding patience and experience in the mental health field. It requires at least a bachelor degree to get hired.
Interview Questions: Describe a crisis situation that you handled well.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Miami, FL) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screening done took out 10 minutes total, I was given general information about the company. It is a salary based position, it requires drug testing and background screening.
Interview Questions: Do you know about our company ?

title: HR Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: one phone interview, and then one Zoom interview. completely ghosted after the Zoom interview, not even an email to say they were not moving forward. tried following up, no response
Interview Questions: have you ever taken minutes before?

title: Qualified Professional Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Personable, appropriate amount of time. Relaxed. Clear. The person interviewing was really kind but took care to make sure they were seeing if the candidate matched the criteria they were looking for.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with this population?

title: Behavior Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: it was quick. it was simple. there was role play involved where the interviewer acted as a child and you were asked to make the interaction fun and gain their attention.
Interview Questions: how would you interact with a child misbehaving?

title: Behavior Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Super fast interview. Friendly staff but can seem like they just want to interview as many people as possible. Lobby was full of others waiting to interview as well makes you wonder how many were offered a position.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with kids with special needs.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: horrible and disorganized experience that was drug out for an unnecessary amount of time very unprofessional and seemed not to have experience with interviewing people there was no communication in between interviews which was frustrating
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Paraprofessional Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: great and informative. they really care and are passionate about the kids. very hands on deck and provides a lot of support. building is well kept and it's another staff around every corner willing to help when's its needed.
Interview Questions: are you familiar with the building and dealing with kids with disabilities of all kind.

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick. Director asked a few questions about self and experience.. roll played playing with a child.. put a few objects on the table and asked how I would entice a child to play.. gave info about position and extended an offer..
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: Great process. They talk about the job and provide a detailed slide show to highlight its aspects. She made sure I understood what this company works for and strives to acoomplish. We discussed different types of benefits that are offered. She allowed me to speak freely of my experience with OT and who I am as a person
Interview Questions: Asked to talk about myself as an OT and expereince. How I heard of easterseals

title: Youth Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Manchester, NH) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was very informative and welcoming! Made the interview process much less stressful. Looking forward to starting here and becoming part of the team! I highly recommend applying for positions here seems like a great group!
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working here?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (Long Beach, CA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very professional, and thorough interviewing staff and personnel. Expedient. Detail oriented, yet open to stream of conscious reply. All experience is taken into consideration. Scheduling is flexible and your time availability is respected.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: Donor Center Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was fine, but it wasn't a fit. I would have liked to have known more about the environment but it seemed like the role was a little undercooked. Seemed like really nice people though
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was organized and went well.  The HR team was polite, responsive, and quite helpful.  I was not available for the role I interviewed for, however, I was moved to consideration for another upcoming role. I have no complaints about the interview process, and I received a hire decision in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experiences in a pediatric setting.

title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held remotely and everything went along smoothly. There were two interviewers and the questions were reasonable and very relevant to the position. The interviews were friendly and made the interview process a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: What is your ABA experience?

title: Life Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience taking with the interviewer, he was very calming and comforting throughout the entire process. He was very generous with the information he gave and how to proceed in the highering process.
Interview Questions: It was a genuine general chat

title: Outpatient Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was engaging and flowed well with the job description.  It was professional and well guided. The interviewer held a warm and friendly approach, and answered any and all questions thoroughly.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had to enforce a policy?

title: Behavioral Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Riverside, CA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: they ask you to describe yourself and bring up scenarios such as a parent wanting your instagram. Also you're asked to role play with the interviewer and see how you would approach the individual in said scenario.
Interview Questions: When was there a time you were given feedback and how did you use that feedback in the workplace.

title: Behavior Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone screening for 10 minutes that asked about my experience and availability. Then around a week later I had a virtual interview with two managers for 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Availability, situational questions, experience with kids

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (Riverside, CA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Intense interview but asked really valid questions. They really care about their clients and want only the best to join their company. They seemed very organized and have a great work life balance from the minimum billable requirements expectations are  achievable and realistic
Interview Questions: What would you change in our field?

title: Survey Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: HR rep failed to engage video call audio for 1:1 online university career fair, rescheduled later that day. She said 2nd interview callback would be early next week, no contact. A week later gives me an email at 12:16 PM with a <4 hours request to submit research samples by 4:00 PM. She send rejection email 9:30AM next morning. Tomorrow is Thanksgiving. How cruel and disorganized.
Interview Questions: Do I know how to collect and analyze survey data.

title: Chief of Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (San Francisco, CA)
Interview Descriptions: After a short phone interview to check general fit and resume, I was invited for an in-person interview. The interviewer was a little delayed, but otherwise professional. The overall experience was fine.
Interview Questions:
Tell me a little bit about you
Why are you interested in this position?

title: IT Support Specialist III (Xolv) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: applied online through Indeed.com, within a couple weeks they reached out to schedule interview, scheduled and did phone call interview/screening. Interview went well and was well qualified. Received rejection email a few days later but was not given any explanation.
Interview Questions: Are you aware this position is in Dublin, CA and how far away is that from you?

title: SLP Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was average, they asked the basic questions about experience and what you are looking for. They discussed the caseload size and a few diagnoses that are in the caseload as well as a typical day within each site.
Interview Questions: Experience with pediatric feeding evaluation/therapy

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Southfield, MI) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went smoothly and the interviewers were very polite, kind, and understanding. It consisted of some hypothetical scenarios and basic background questions. Overall, it was slightly difficult. I did struggle a bit with the scenarios so I would suggest preparing for this beforehand.
Interview Questions: How would you respond if one of your consumers wasn't following their treatment plan?

title: Client Financial Services Payment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Easterseals in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The hiring coordinator was really great to work with setting up the interview and going over general questions. The interview itself with the manager was very abrupt and thrown together last minute. Also, she told me the position i applied for was filled but told me about another position i may fit. At the end I asked how to follow up and she pretty much said we’ll call you with a yes or no in the following week. Never heard back..
Interview Questions: What do you expect out of a manager?

title: Special Education Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: online interview, not too bad at all. But be sure to be prepared, answer honestly and all should go well. I prepared days before and had a greast time in my interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us

title: Registered Behavior Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Great. They are looking for patient people who can handle behaviors from kids. Asked simple and straightforward questions, mostly about experience working in the field with kids . Good interview.
Interview Questions: What makes you great for this job?

title: Early Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Florence, SC) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: On zoom. The director and supervisor were great. They asked a lot of questions. Went over responsibilities, benefits. It was a good experience. I was contacted two days later and got the job!
Interview Questions: What do you think will be the hardest challenge of being an early interventionist?

title: Direct Care Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Raleigh, NC) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application on the Easterseal website and they contacted me! They required a high school diploma which I thought was odd but I could only provide a Masters degree. They accepted the masters.
Interview Questions: Do you have transportation to reach clients?

title: Behavior Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is easy and very straight forward. You might have 2 or 3 person interviewing at the same time. There is usually a second round of interview if you did well on the first.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself with  the company in 3 to 5 years?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Chillicothe, OH) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I scheduled an interview a week after applying, it went well and I had high hopes for it; three weeks later I have not heard a word from them even though I was told that the supervisor would call me within a few days.
Interview Questions: There was no true questions asked.

title: Case Management Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Meeting was over zoom with HUnan Resources and department supervisor. Interview went great, very conversational, they made me feel very comfortable and seemed genuinely interested in my responses. They  asked basic interview  questions, nothing too difficult. Was then sent on to next phase which was an online assessment.
Interview Questions: What is your management style?

title: Direct Care Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Got a call, within a couple days of applying, from recruiting and talked for about ten minutes.  It was a quick phone call.  The staff was friendly and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: How did you hear about us?

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The interview was not clear with the next steps. When I was offered the position they did not tell me I would have to go to an all-day training for four days. Since this was a part-time job for me on the side I was unable to attend and had to reject the position.
Interview Questions: Situational examples of showing the fun games you would do with the clients

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions:
Experience questions 
situational questions about behaviour management and missing children procedures 
creative pitch of a week you would organize and how you would carry this out 
Housekeeping questions about availability to attend training weeks and the process of arriving at camp 
pay expectation
Interview Questions: Describe a theme you might organize and how you would carry this out

title: Program Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy and basic since it was a entry level position. It was a Summer position to work with Youth and have daily activities. They i wanted a facilitators that had experience working with youth.
Interview Questions: How can you implement skills into children's daily lives

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Easterseals (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter through a campus fair to set up an interview. I was given detailed instructions on the interview process by the recruiter. The whole process had clear communication.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with people with disabilities before?

title: Early Inteventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: They interviewed by asking questions from a paper. It was the HR person, Head of ECI and another person. Also had a second interview after with the director of Easter Seals for my area.
Interview Questions: Why should we choose you to work for us?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: This was confusing because the Interview asked specific questions about being in/from the area. However being from the area described was not mentioned as a job requirement and also I believe to be illegal?
Interview Questions: What is your salary range?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Great questions, warm, friendly.  You could tell they really care about their employees and the future of people retainment.   They did a great job of telling me about the role and the overall culture of the organization.  Seems like a great place to work.
Interview Questions: Tell us about past challenges and how you overcame them.

title: AVID Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Easterseals in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Contacted the website about arranging an interview, they replied immediately and arranged a date for the following week. I didn’t have to submit any documents apart from my CV which was great.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this company?

title: Behavioral Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Application, phone interview, face to face interview if you passed the phone interview. The interviewer was running late actually, but besides that was very professional. I was hired on the spot
Interview Questions: How much experience I had working with children, but specifically children with autism

title: Regional Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (New Brunswick, NJ) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: 3 step interview. 2nd interview was with a panel.  There is also an online test for senior positions that is given prior to the panel interview that is difficult. Overall, the interview process with easterseals is difficult, but makes you feel as though they have a good onboarding process for new employees and are good at filtering out individuals who may not be a good fit.
Interview Questions: They were interested in my financial acumen.

title: Early Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: HR emailed me and offered a few windows of time. Interview took place via Google Meet. The interview questions were pretty standard  (what are your strengths/weaknesses, philosophy on EI, former jobs, etc). Took about 20 minutes to complete
Interview Questions: What are your strengths? What are your weaknesses? Former jobs and how those skills would apply in this job

title: Outpatient Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Raleigh, NC) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Sent resume prior to interview. Interview was over video chat. Discussed specifics of job. The job was not available for a month, so have to have a call back interview.
Interview Questions: What I was looking for and how they fit into that

title: BCBA-Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Charlotte, NC) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: initial phone interview; questions about current position and professional goals, description of company and position available, questions related to professional integrity, management style, and preference for salary, panel of interviewers via telephone, lots of questions related directly to work experience and ability to perform tasks as a BCBA
Interview Questions: Desired salary, most difficult job situation, ability to manage others, etc.

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Easterseals (Corona, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very hands on, met with an assistant for ipad knowledge and email professionalism test and then met with someone from corporate for a role playing interview. Prepare to act like you are working with a child.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a child you worked with got distracted?

title: Family Resource Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: It was an intense interview that asked a lot of behavioral based questions. It took about an hour and involved a panel of about 3 supervisors on the team. I got called back for another interview that had a written portion of it and more in depth questions. I got An email indicating the job offer and salary.
Interview Questions: What is consider strength based to you?

title: Behavior Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and they quickly replied within two days. They then asked me for an interview at the job site. First, they ask me to watch videos that described that shared information about the position and company. After watching the videos, the interviewer asked a few questions about myself. The interview was short and sweet. Also, they ask you to role-play and watch how you would handle the scenario given.
Interview Questions: What interested you in applying for this position?

title: Community Living Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Easterseals in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: When I was interviewed it was an open interviews. I was asked a series of questions that are common in job interviews. After this first interview I was called back for another interview and soon after offered the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had to deal with a coworker or another peer that was difficult to work with/ or had a confrontation, how did you handle it and what was the outcome?

title: MST Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Greenville, NC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied and did not hear back after two weeks, reached out to the supervisor of the region and was given an interview within the next week. There is a two-part interview. First interview is based around asking lots of generic questions: tell me about yourself, ask about how you would handle situations that you would be faced with in the field, your thoughts on MST and the website.
Interview Questions: Is there a theory that you like most?

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Bakersfield, CA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, lady seemed nice and down to earth. I have an in person interview next week. I currently work for another ABA company but im hoping to jump on board with this company. Has so much more to offer
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you with chasing after kiddos or having to sit, run, bend etc?

title: Direct Support Professional Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very laid back- like a conversation. There was no hard questions, just the normal interview questions. The HR person I interviewed with was very nice and I was offered the position on the spot. All of the office staff were very pleasant.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable working with people with disabilities?

title: Employment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Basically, the manager just told me about the position. Did not ask me any questions except about my availability, I was offered the job a couple of days later.
Interview Questions: Availability?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and supportive interview process. There were no concerns, and all of my questions were answered. The interviewers we're knowledgeable and friendly. I felt comfortable and at ease. I was able to get a walkthrough of the facility.
Interview Questions: How does your skill set align with the company's mission statement?

title: Compliance Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Salem, VA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter contact and then 2 face to face interviews in different areas.  Personality test was excellent for the position and the results/description was sent as a follow-up even though I was not offered a position. Was a great experience and I really hated not getting an offer.
Interview Questions: Past experience

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met with the director of the camp. She was very welcoming and for one of my first job interviews, she was very welcoming and complimentary. Be sure to have an experience with this population that you can discuss or express how much you'd like to gain experience with this population for the future.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a challenging experience you had and how you handled it (in relation to working with children or individuals with IDD)?

title: Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Worcester, MA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I met with a staff member, we discussed my experiences and goals. We toured the facility, especially the AAC library, and spoke about schools/nursing homes I may be placed in. I talked about my clinical work and willingness to be flexible.
Interview Questions: What area do you want to specialize in?

title: Client Financial Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Fort Wayne, IN) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: A lot of in-depth questions were asked, but you know that it was thorough.  They were respectful and absorbent of my answers.  Even if I wasn't completely knowledgeable in a subject, they were helpful and receptive.
Interview Questions: How have I handled dealing with a difficult client in the past?

title: Job Placement Service Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Had an initial call with hiring manger.  Interviewed in person with hiring manager, direct supervisor and another staff member at the same time.  Met with head of HR as well.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard interview questions.

title: Community Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Easterseals (Manchester, MO) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview starts with a call from an HR Generalist. From there there is an initial meeting with a director or the VP. During this interview the thought process, reactions and responses are gauged for the overall impression.
Interview Questions: What is something that you have done to better someone else?

title: Peer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Raleigh, NC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was lead supervisor. He mostly described the program and when asked questions about growth within the company, he did not appear to like that. Also, the pay for what was expected was not conducive for job expectations.
Interview Questions: What brings me to the field?

title: Benefits Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals (Raleigh, NC)
Interview Descriptions: I was internal.  I sent my resume, got a response and then an interview was scheduled.  I went to the interview and go a response back about 5 days later.  I was internal so i had to give a months notice.
Interview Questions: Why this company?

title: Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Lake Worth, FL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a very thorough interview. An observation and report was required.  Checked on all of my references and talked to me about the process and where they are at. It was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult situation and how did you resolve it?

title: Behavior Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: You are asked general interview questions. Have to engage in role play; you are the Behavior Interventionist and the interviewer is the child. They may present scenarios and ask what you would do.
Interview Questions: What teaching strategies do you find most beneficial?

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Easterseals (Orlando, FL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy, hiring manager was friendly and clear about the responsibilities.  I felt like I understood the role thoroughly. I had a lot of questions about working at a sleep away camp, and the summer heat especially being in Florida. All my questions were answered.
Interview Questions: How do I feel about giving personal care

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: In person meeting with two administrators.  Then follow up interview on site.  Interview was direction questioning regarding my experience, strengths and qualifications.  The interview lasted about 40 minutes.  One of the administrators was frequently checking her watch during the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about  a challenging situation at a workplace?

title: Behavior Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was roughly 45 minutes long. Upon arrival, I was told to watch a video about the company. During my interview, I was then asked questions in regards to the video. There was a scenario part, where I had to play the part of a BI while the interviewer was a client.
Interview Questions: How long has easter seals been around

title: Community Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Hiring Process was relatively easy. Phone screening first to determine if you are a reputable candidate and ask questions primarily on your experience and what personality you have, then a second interview takes place at the office and your offer will be made immediately or in a couple days depending if there are other interviewees.
Interview Questions: What makes you believe you are a good representative for this organization?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Western Location, MI) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The entire process from beginning to end felt comfortable! The interviewer made me feel calm and relaxed! I would suggest others to check out this program. I hope others have an experience similar to mine.
Interview Questions: Do you have current experience? What is it that you are looking for? Do you have a problem with people riding in your vehicle? When can you start?

title: Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Fort Wayne, IN) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very knowledgeable and caring.  Very Nice employees that conducted the interview very professionally. Connected with me personally and professionally. Very informative about the position and expectations. Answered my questions fully and got back with me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Business Intelligence Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Fremont, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short and easy but they have to interview in person to get a better understanding of the person. They have zero tolerance for anyone who is making too much errors. If you make too much errors after getting the job, you will get fired.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself?

title: Community Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Columbus, OH) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very lax and unprofessional. I was told the hardest part of the job is dealing with the “idiot employees.” Overall a very uneasy experience. I did not feel good once the interview was over.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakness?

title: Entry Level Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Pasadena, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed at the Pasadena location. Upon arriving, they hand you a questionnaire regarding your experience and knowledge of ABA and terms. When you finish, you then go forward with the interview. There was questions about myself, situation questions and role play.
Interview Questions: If a parent sees the therapy session as babysitting services and decides to run errands and leave the house, what would you tell the parent to make them stay?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: When I was laid off from LifeSpan, they had been providing my services.  They had been sending out a worker to be with me for that 5 hours I was there to help me with personal care (because I am disabled).  They offered me a job and I took it.  Unfortunately there was no real interview I can speak of.
Interview Questions: The supervisor asked me how I can benefit the company.

title: Behavior Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (San Bernardino, CA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fast  And mostly about aba and working with children. Had to role play as well.  Study about aba before going in to the interview and I think you should be fine.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Worcester, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was promptly sent a list of questions via e-mail as a pre-interview screening. I was then set up with an in-person interview with the Rehab Services Director which was pleasant and informative. Took 1 month from application to job offer, which I accepted
Interview Questions: Describe was your most difficult client, how did you react in the moment, and how has it shaped your clinical decision making and approach to similar situations?

title: HR Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Easterseals (Manchester, NH) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: A year ago, I applied for a role I am definitely qualified for in HR.  I had a phone interview and two (long) face to face interviews with multiple people.  I then received another offer, but was hoping to get the offer from EasterSeals instead.  A few weeks had gone by at that point w/no communicate or status.  I reached out and was told they went with someone else. OK no problem.  A year later (2019) I see the same role is open again.  I apply again, and get a call from someone at EasterSeals to talk about the role. I am excited, I call back and to be honest and totally upfront, I mentioned to her that I went very far a year ago w/the same position but was not offered the job. She says she still wants to chat with me based on my resume.  About an hour later, I get a "Thank you for your interest" email.  That's it.  I found that incredibly unprofessional. I am okay if I am not the right "fit" but do your research. Look up to see the history on a candidate who already went through several rounds of interviews already and have the courtesy to call me directly and not hide behind an email that is generated by a computer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: I did a short phone interview before being invited for an in-person interview. I was told to plan a short therapy session, and was given information for the student I'd be working with. When I arrived, I was given a tour of the school and then I performed the therapy session. The interviewers gave constructive feedback and were very supportive and friendly. There was the traditional question and answer interview session, an opportunity for me to answer questions, and then there were 3 written case study questions. Very thorough interview process, and again, everyone I came in contact with the entire time I was there were very friendly and helpful.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict in the workplace?

title: Foster Grandparent/Champions for Children Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I went into the interview and the hiring manger was very nice. She told me in dept about hiring position and what the job entailed.  I thought that the interview went great, but 2 weeks past and I had not heard back from the hiring program director nor HR. I emailed the director about 3 times and called her once with a voicemail. On my  3rd time mailing her HR finally emailed me a decline letter a few minutes after. It was not very professional how many times I had to follow up with no answer back. I would have probably never been updated had I kept sending emails.
Interview Questions: Why would I be a good fit for the organization?

title: Youth Support Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Manchester, NH)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was informal and easy. Questions were generic and straight forward. They seemed willing to hire anybody with the right credentials and a good attitude. The interviewers were two managers who interviewed me in a small office space.
Interview Questions: Are you capable of working hands on with special needs clients?

title: Regional Clinical Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Valencia, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through the recruitment department.  Was given a call back that same day.  An interview was scheduled about 3 weeks after I applied.  1 to 1 interview. Was asked many questions about my background and previous employment. Also was asked questions regarding how I would respond if I was given a directive that I did not agree with. Was given the impression that the organization wanted a person for the position that would strictly follow orders.
Interview Questions: How much notice would you give if you were to leave the position?

title: Case Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Ankeny, IA)
Interview Descriptions: Only went to screening interview. I ended the process due to lower than expected salary. Almost all the questions were behavioral "tell me about a time you...." The interviewer was friendly, and said she would keep my application on file if something at a higher level opened up.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you mediated a conflict.

title: Administrative Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Waterbury, CT)
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone interviews and was asked to travel to Connecticut for a third in-person interview. Met with CEO and later group interview with other senior staff, including HR, CFO/COO, Administrative Director of another division, and a Program Director who would be a direct report. Very little small talk. I was asked mostly questions which were answered on my resume. All those interviewing had a copy of my resume. I sensed that the group made up their minds about my eligibility for the position within moments of meeting me.
Interview Questions: Please provide an example of a time you collaborated with others.

title: Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Process was typical of that for a school who in desperate need to fill the SLP slot. The directors did offered insight on what a typical day would look like and answered all questions throughly.
Interview Questions: Which test are you most comfortable with giving?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Easy and quick interview.  Everyone was nice and supportive through interview process. I received call back rather quickly and was updated frequently. Amazing recruiters that care. Simple and easy interview overall.
Interview Questions: Experience

title: Developmental Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Las Vegas, NV) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really easy and I got hired in the spot. The questions are very basic and should be easy to answer if you have spent any time around children.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult parent

title: Substitute Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was conducted in an easy format. It felt like a friendly and easy going place to work at if I should get the job. There were no surprises during the whole interview process.
Interview Questions: When will I be able to start?

title: TMS Peer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Raleigh, NC) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview with a team lead and then second interview with team.  Common questions, be yourself. Great work place, fantastic group, great team lead! The hiring process is long be patient, it’s worth the hire. Write a good cover letter, try and keep it simple.
Interview Questions: What are your 3 strengths, 3 challenges and tell me a personal goal you have and how you over come it....

title: Paraprofessional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
They have you shadow for half day or so in a specific classroom that most likely you will be placed in. They will also try to start you off with low hourly rate but I negotiated 3x and got a higher rate than many of the other paras BUT I firmly believe I was underpaid based on my related work experience. 
They also do NOT tell you that before you begin you have to spend over $100 on a certification in order to work there which is messed up. They tell you after you've been hired and still offer a low ball hourly rate.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with special needs? If yes, explain.

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: You wait at the waiting room and they call you one by one. You have a 1:1 interview with the clinical supervisor and ask you series of questions. If they like you, they send you straight to the HR. The HR calls you back in couple of days to discuss salary.
Interview Questions: What do you know about autism?

title: Autism Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Las Vegas, NV)
Interview Descriptions:
I thought it was an amazing interview. They told me a little bit about Easter Seals and explains to me the different things they provide. Asked me a few questions about the job wrote down what I said. If you know what you are talking about and what they are talking about then it was pretty easy. I was asked what my availability would be and she also told me I needed to have a phone interview with the director next. So I am currently waiting for the phone interview.
I wasn't offered or declined the job..
Interview Questions: What experiences have you had with behavior?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The interview process ran smoothly.  I felt really comfortable.  The first interview, I had a interview with the Grants Manager.  I had a second interview with the CFO and Director of Finance.  All of them were very nice and told me about the job and Easter Seals.
Interview Questions: How do you handle change?

title: Adult Education Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Manchester, NH) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Casual and conversational,  In-person interview with upper management twice.  Toured facility and shadowed classroom,  I was told about the schedule and duties required for the role.  I was able to observe multiple classes and meet other employees.
Interview Questions: Asked about past experience and motivations to apply for the job,

title: Site Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: More of an interrogation than an interview.  The interviewer acts like you are supposed to know the job before you are provided with training.  Promotion is based on favoritism.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a client was in crisis?  How would you intervene?  What is the proper procedure?

title: Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Very prompt with notifying you about interview date/time as well as the follow up decision afterwards! Prior to that, I had to chase down human resource person regarding whether or not they received my resume.
Interview Questions: What prior experience I had?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Chillicothe, OH) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Quite casual, seemed more like a conversation rather than a formal interview. I was mostly told what the position entailed and the times and days that I would be working. It was a receptionist position and they explained that it also served as an assistant (secretary) position. They asked a few questions regarding my resume and asked when I would be available. I believe that were going to hire me but I was not able to start as soon as the wanted due to a prior commitment which I explained to them. They didn't tell me this and I never received a call or letter telling me that I didn't get the position.
Interview Questions: Asked: Have you had any experience with disabled people.

title: Behavioral Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: 10 mins interview panel inteview. the process started with role play scenario which the intwrview was a child with Autism. Asked me a few questions and gave me an overview of the job.
Interview Questions: describe a time which you taught someone something new

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Easterseals (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: My experience was ok, the person I interviewing me was rushing the interview because she had a meeting. Easy interview if you know about ABA. My interview was only 10 minutes but on boarding took 2 months.
Interview Questions: Reinforcement scheduling?

title: Caregiver Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (Tucson, AZ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty simple really. Fill out an application, take a simple test on a computer, then speak to 3 people. (At the same time) They randomly asked all kinds of questions. It was not rushed.
Interview Questions: Where do you see your self in 5 years?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and  was emailed for an interview within a few days. I went in for the interview which was very easy going, more like a conversation. I was offered a job over the phone a few days later.
Interview Questions: What population do you want to work with?

title: Behavior Interventionalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Burlingame, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I found Easter Seals through Craigslist. I applied online and was notified that I would be a good candidate for an in person interview. I did my 1:1 at the Burlingame, CA office. The office was very spacious and big. The woman I did my interview with was very nice and smiled a lot. According to some reviews, you are given an assessment so I studied terms beforehand. I actually did not have to do an assessment, she went straight to the questions. The interview was about 30 minutes long. After reading questions from a packet of paper, she told me that she was going to bring in the clinical manager to meet me. Both of the ladies notified me that I got the job, which I agreed to take.
Interview Questions:
Phone Interview:
Tell me about yourself?
Are you willing to drive from location to location?
Can you work so and so hours?
What do you do at your current job?
Have you worked with kids with special needs?

In person interview:
How did you hear about us?
Do you have a second job?
Have you worked with children with special needs?
Are you willing to work so and so hours?
Name a time you worked with a child that was difficult and what did you do?
Have you done home visits?
What was it like when you did home visits?
What's the hardest thing about home visits for you?
Have you ever heard of ABA?
What is ABA?

title: Behavioral Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Quick, the staff asked easy questions. The staff was nice, they tested your ABA knowledge, asked you how you knew about their company. The two interviewers were interested in your knowledge of ABA  and your previous experience with working with children with Autism.
Interview Questions: What do you know about ABA and how did you find our about us

title: Direct Support Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Easterseals (Newton, NJ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with a supervisor, initially, in Sparta, Nj and they went over my resume and we talked about my career desires, where I wanted to be in 5-10 years. She and Ispoke about the hourly rate and the travel involved with the position and did I have a car and a good driving record.  I answered that travel is fine and she also added that mileage is paid, which was a good thing.
Interview Questions: Did I enjoy working with diverse groups of people

title: Clinical Fellow - Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: after you submit your resume, you get a phone interview. if they decide they like you, you go in for an in person interview. my interview was around 2 hours. that included a tour of the facilities and questions. for me personally, it took about a month to get a response
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Behavioral Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Torrance, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I did a 20-minute phone interview, followed by an interview in person which included a two-page questionnaire on ABA. The questionnaire isn't multiple choice, so you can't take guesses. It had questions such as "what is positive reinforcement? what is punishment? what is a mand?", etc. During the phone interview I was asked mostly situational questions. Personally I thought the in-person interview was easier than the phone interview. In person, the interviewer asked me 6 questions that she had typed on a piece of paper, so I assume the questions are the same for everyone. Even though I was told by phone that there may be some role-play involved during the in-person interview, I was not asked to role play. I was offered the position 5 days after the face to face interview.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you had a challenge at work and how you handled it. Explain a time when a parent was not happy with your work. What is the most valuable thing you learned from your old job?

title: DSP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Easterseals (New Brunswick, NJ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview appeared informative when job was described.  Answered all my questions, however, when hired and started the job there were things that would come up unexpectedly and I felt I had to flounder around to get a straight answer. Ask in the interview what types of situations may arise so you are well prepared before taking the job.
Interview Questions: Clean drivers license? Some situations of working with clients experiences and how you handled them.

title: Autism Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my resume online. First had a phone call interview. It was about 15 and prelim screwing process. Then I was asked to go in to meet the regional director for a in person interview. At the one on one interview I first answered a writing questionnaire of about 5-10 questions and then I went in for the one on one. They were very prompt in calling back and letting me know about the position.
Interview Questions: What is a time that you were frustrated at work? What happened and what did you do?

title: Helpdesk Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Easterseals (San Francisco, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Online job posting, Phone interview first , then call for in person interview, Quick, the staff asked easy questions. The staff was ok, they tested your IT knowledge, asked you how you knew about their company.
Interview Questions: What is your achievement in your life.

title: Junior ABA Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very short but informative. Questions were easy and the interviewer gave a tour of the building and informed me of what my job duties would be. I was also allowed to ask questions and get detailed information of what the company is about.
Interview Questions: Have you heard of ABA therapy? What does it mean to you?

title: Behavioral Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Easterseals (Rancho Cucamonga, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a position at the company and they lost my application. Followed up a month later, and they stated they lost my application but did not apologize. Took another month to receive an interview, and another month after that to begin working. Overall, it was a 3-month process to begin working at the company - which is ridiculous. The interview itself was an easy experience; the interviewers asked very normal questions related to the position and past experience, and made me feel very comfortable. Yet, they stated information to me during the interview which I would find out months later would be false (concerning compensation policies). It was very un-professional and misleading to state information prior to hiring to appear to make the position more desirable.
Interview Questions: Acted out a situation which would occur during the job. The interviewer acted as a child as you role-played possible situations.

title: Behavioral Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy interview in a smallish, quiet office in a larger office building.  Interviewer asked some basic questions and then she had us sit on the floor and do a role play - she was a 3 year old non verbal toddler and I had to make various objects interesting, basically by acting silly and getting creative with usually boring objects like a rubber band, post it notes, highlighter, etc
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with individuals with Autism?

title: Assistant Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Easterseals in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was placed in a classroom to be observed.  The purpose was to see if I could effectively and efficiently interact with children, teachers, and parents in a toddler setting.
Interview Questions: What credentials do you have?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Des Moines, IA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Emailed application to hiring manager, was contacted by HR within a week. Offered in person interview with HR staff initially, and then a follow-up in person interview for a different position which I didn't apply for. After second interview, took about a week to hear back and I did not get offered that second position, but instead was offered a third interview for a third position. Long and drawn out process, and I did not end up receiving a full-time offer from them, but instead a PRN position on weekends or as needed. I declined this offer, as it was not in my field or interest.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you were faced with a work conflict, and what did you do? Tell me about your favorite supervisor and what about them you liked?

title: Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (Rancho Cucamonga, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Initially, I received an email confirmation stating that my application had been received.  After the application deadline, I received a phone call from an HR recruiter for a phone screening.  A couple days later, I received another phone call to schedule a 1:1 interview in the Rancho Cucamonga office.  The day of the interview, I was greeted by two Lead Scheduler, both whom led the interview.  I was asked a few questions with regards to the position.  Once the interview was done, I was warmly thanked for my time and informed that I will receive notice in a few days with regards to their decision.
Interview Questions: What do you think the duties of a scheduler entities?

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Did not take long, there were a lot of other canidates. Interview was fairly easy. There was a brief written questionnaire about autism and behavior modification techniques. It was more of "see where you are" kinda thing. I knew about these questions from a friend who referred me. Make sure you know about autism a little and ABA therapy/techniques.
Interview Questions: Would you rather use positive or negative reinforcement when working with a child?

title: Direct Support Professional Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Manchester, NH)
Interview Descriptions: The manager making the interview was very nice and profesional with me... It is funny that they make an enfasis that you will be working with fisically agresive clients, they will ask you for an auto insurance, you have to make a medical examination and a two weeks training
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Supervisor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews , the initial interview was not so bad. It was a basic interview that consisted of familiarity with the field and situations in which I had to utilize skills required to fullfill the job requirement in my current or past positions. The second interview was much more intense and required more in depth knowledge of the methodologies required to perform certain tasks. The second interview lasted much longer than planned and gave clear and concise expectations of me if I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: What are some of the ABA procedures that you use on a regular basis, and how do you keep up with the effectiveness of the treatment plan.

title: Human Resources Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview with Easter Seals of North Georgia was the longest most extensive interview that I have had in awhile.  The interview was conducted by the CEO and a Sr. VP.  They interviewed as much as they talked.  I received a real sense that they were seriously and intently focused on finding just the right candidate.  They ended up selecting someone from within the organization.
Interview Questions: How do you use metrics?

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals (Hudson, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview began as the standard questions an employer might ask--your strengths and weaknesses, your interests, previous job experience, etc.  You have to be ready for the unexpected though--I was asked to sing on the spot.  This request was asked because as a camp counselor, you are expected to go above and beyond for your campers.  If they want to be serenaded during breakfast, lunch, or dinner, you sing your heart out.  You don't have to be good, you just have to do it.
Interview Questions: To sing.

title: Direct Care Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Des Moines, IA)
Interview Descriptions: Sent in application, had a typical interview. Was offered the job contingent on passing a physical. They were willing to work with me on my schedule. The whole process was fairly quick. They have fairly high turnover so I think they are always needing people which probably speeds up the process.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with people with disabilities?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Pleasant Hill, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: asked questions about experience, management style, difficult situations with families, difficult situations with coworkers, how to handle escalated issues, how to communicate with upper management, how to solve conflict with outside vendor, how to sole conflict between peers, previous experiences, overall experience, and how to work well with others.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a conflict with a coworker

title: Paraprofessional Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Easterseals (Greensboro, NC) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was easy. I applied by sending my email to the group home supervisor. They responded to me within two weeks. I had a phone interview then was asked to come in for a face to face interview. Asked about my background and told me a little about the job and asked if I'd be comfortable with it. Maybe a week or two later I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Describe your Mental Health experience.

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Pleasant Hill, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and painless process. The interviewer was very easygoing and relatable, it seemed like all the hiring managers were the same way- very kind- and that showed during the interview. They ask you about your experiences and really don't want to hear a canned response of what you think you're supposed to say- but truly what your life and life experiences have taught you, and in turn, what you bring to the table because of those.
Interview Questions: In your previous jobs, when have you had a challenging experience with a child? With a parent?

title: Accounting Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (East Brunswick, NJ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I emailed my resume and cover letter. Within 2 days I was called, but missed the call. It took about a week to reach someone. Once I got in contact with the hr rep, I was screened over the phone and was asked to come in for an interview. Within two days I interviewed and two days after that I was called with an offer.
Interview Questions: Give me two words that describe you?

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Easterseals (Anaheim, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: 1:1, asked if I have worked with children. Made me get on the ground and play with toys. Interviewer pretended he was a child with autism. I had to be creative and play like I would with a child. Used my ABA skills by avoiding bad behavior and redirecting him to something positive.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with children being aggressive?

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview, followed by a one-on-one interview with the regional director. Phone interview is to verify that you meet the minimum qualifications (Bachelor's degree). The second interview is your chance to let the employer know about your previous experiences.
Interview Questions: How do you think your previous experience is applicable to this job position?

title: SCL Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Easterseals (Des Moines, IA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I Immediately got in for a first interview after applying on line (within 24 hours), followed by a second interview the following day. The interviewers were both polite and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: The questions were "tell me an experience when..." and then the outcome. Some of the questions were replicated during the second interview. They were all related to values and ethics.

title: Easter Seals Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Easterseals in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty informal - just one 30 minute long interview.  Some behavioral questions, but mostly it was just me talking about my experience and what not. It was more to get to know me.
Interview Questions: It was mostly just behavioral questions about different emergency situations

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: There's a phone interview and then you get a face to face interview where ask you to do a spreadsheet. They call for a second interview and before you attend the second interview you need to make a flyer
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to make difficult decision

title: Autism Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Sacramento, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Company recruiter will conduct initial telephone screening. The caller id from recruiter will appear as a personal mobile number. An interview is scheduled with department manager and assistant manager. In Person interview is casual. Interviewer uses predetermined questions. It is recommended that you call HR recruiter after interview. HR recruiter will review job title, benefits, salary, training dates, and requisites before final offer.
Interview Questions: Standard: How many years experience? Describe Education?  What did you pursue this field? What is the most difficult aspect of field? Describe most difficult patient/client? Describe a situation where you disagreed with supervisor? Describe a situation where a patient/client attempts to malign your supervisor how would you handle that?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Easterseals in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very quick.  Took about 10 minutes.  Questions about education.  Questions about experience.  After the interview, had to go to get drug tested and a physical.
Interview Questions: I was asked to put in order 4 different emergencies according to importance.

title: Behavioral Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Pleasant Hill, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then received and invitation via email for a phone interview 2 days later. Phone interview lasted about 20 minutes and then I was asked to schedule an in person interview for the following week. During the in person interview I met with two clinical people and was offer the job on the spot. There was no room for salary negotiation.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a parent that was not on board with the treatment goals?

title: Early Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Easterseals (Hilo, HI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview questions gave an overall view of what the job in tailed. Each question required an example of how you would approach, plan, or what you have done in the past relating to children's behavioral needs and developmental delays. They were extremely polite and friendly. The questions were not intimidating.
Interview Questions: How would you approach a child who is demonstrating aggressive behaviors?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Fort Wayne, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It seems at the time they were willing to hire anyone for the position. I had an initial phone call and the next interview was simply picking my hours and taking a personality test to see who, as a supervisor I would be compatible with. Then, I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a situation where you feel someone else is breaking the rules?

title: Paraprofessional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: I went to the open interviews for Easter Seals. It was an enjoyable, down to earth interview. The next day I got a chance to observe the classrooms and meet the great staff and students.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where a child is calling you the worst name you can imagine?

title: DSP Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Joliet, IL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Routine questions. The interviewer wanted to know why I needed the job, They gave a layout of what Easter seals is all about. One more thing ...they wanted me to know ahead of time that move staff from one facility to another ...at short or no notice. Do I have an issue with that ?
Interview Questions: Just personal questions, and what the job is about

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Easterseals (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: this position was designated through a lengthy process mostly undertaken by the people who work at the school that I go to. They were the ones who found this location and placed me, and I was not very involved, so I'm not sure exactly what to say in this section besides the fact that I was placed there by coordinators.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Hilliard, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The application process was lengthy, I applied 2 months prior to receiving a call from the company to interview. The interview process was straight forward, it started with a phone screening, then a call back to schedule the interview followed by 2 interviews in different locations.
Interview Questions: What is your time management style?

title: Caregiver Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (Winter Park, FL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy going relaxed interview with 3 different people all very friendly. Background screening and drug test process was quick and easy. HR was quick with getting back to me and letting me know what paperwork I needed to turn in
Interview Questions: Why do you like caring for others

title: Clinical Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Rocky Mount, NC) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by MSTi, with clinical and supervision questions. The MSTi consultant followed the MST Supervisor recruitment manual. I answered questions regarding clinical and MST model focus for treatment planning for a scenario with a family. The MSTi consultant role-played with me scenarios with a therapist on my team, parents of clients, DJJ, and DSS.
Interview Questions: I was told that I will have a difficult team, and can I handle the skill building involved, and working with the manager stop the constant, and probably untrue, complaints by the team against former supervisors.

title: Early Intervention Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Greenville, SC) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through indeed. I called and checked in two weeks after I applied. They called me five weeks after I applied and wanted to set up an interview. The interview was at a Starbucks, very relaxed interview. I heard back from them the next day. They checked my background, and I did fingerprints, sent my transcript, and they called my references. Once all of this was complete, they called and offered me the job. This process took two weeks before they could offer me the job.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you walked into a house that had cockroaches crawling across the floors?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Valhalla, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was a phone interview with the HR Assistant.  Interview lasted approximately 15 minutes. Person doing the phone interview/screening was knowledgeable about the position and had the responsibility of doing the initial screening for the position.  Following the interview, the HR Assistant was to make recommendations to the Department Manager for face-to-face interview.  This was an internship for credit position.
Interview Questions: Since you are completing your Masters Degree in Human Resource Management, why would you want to do an internship as an HR Assistant.

title: Behavioral Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Easterseals (Aptos, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: You go to the office for a 1 on 1  interview. This can last anywhere from 30-60min. Depending on the position you are applying for they will ask you basic interview questions and then ask how you may choose to handle a number of different situations. If hired you need to get TB testing, CPR certified, fingerprinted and background check.
Interview Questions: This company would like to know about your education, previous experience and what you would do in a variety of different circumstances depending on what type of position you are applying to.

title: Rehab Team Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process went by very quickly.  I sent in an online  resume via the website. I later  got a call back to set up a face- to-face interview.  The interview was with the director of rehab/autism team.  It was a very basic interview where I was asked about myself and about my past experiences in rehab.  She wanted to know how I felt about Autism Spectrum since many kids there are ASD.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: MST Therapist Interview
