Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: I sent my information online I was initially contacted by a supervisor in the department to have a meeting and discuss the position and the MST therapy process. After that, and after my interest was gauged another meeting was set up in order to ask questions based on experience, skills, and some of those rather "standard" interview questions (e.g. where you see yourself in five years, strengths and weaknesses). A lot of the questions will be discussing experience with family therapy and experience in providing counseling. The second interview will be a role play interview in which you are given several cases to role play with the interviewer in order to see and qualify your skills in vivo. All of these interviews are group interviews with multiple managers/supervisors.
Interview Questions: Role play cases, as it's difficult to prepare for this type of nontraditional interview "question."

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: one phone interview (half an hour), one in person interview that was mostly information from me about what my expectations from the job was, really nice recruiter and thorough questions to gauge the quality of my experience
Interview Questions: all relatively easy questions, what has your previous experience with working with children with autism bene like

title: Paraprofessional Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (Charlotte, NC) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: go over resume and qualifications, sign paperwork, then you are told your salary, benefits and gas milage.go over resume and qualifications, sign paperwork, then you are told your salary, benefits and gas milage.go over resume and qualifications, sign paperwork, then you are told your salary, benefits and gas milage.go over resume and qualifications, sign paperwork, then you are told your salary, benefits and gas milage
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with the special needs population?

title: SPED Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (Rockford, IL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview with principal of campus. Simple questions. If you have taught or know anything about teaching and appear presentable, you have a good chance of being hired. Have to pass drug test and consistently be able to pass.
Interview Questions: My philosophy on teaching.

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Santa Ana, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very quick, phone interview and then a face to face interview. They contacted me within a week to get a job interview. The face to face interview was unique. We role played and there was a specific goal he wanted me to reach.
Interview Questions: They did role playing - pretended one was a nonverbal child with autism - you had to react to it.

title: ABA Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Grapevine, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email notification shortly after to do an in-person interview. Before the interview, I was given forms to fill out and then proceeded with the interview. I talked to the director as well as the BCBAs who also explained more about the role and more about the company.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Special Education Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process in well thought out. First there is a phone interview. Then there is a panel interview with other teachers and administrators. They will go around the table and ask you various questions about your teaching experience, knowledge on best practice, and answers to scenarios.  You then have a task to complete that entails preparing a lesson and teaching it in form of a group of students.
Interview Questions: The most difficult part in the task of teaching the lesson as the students have unexpected behaviors at times. Ask ahead of time to be put in contact with the students to best learn about their students. This will help you to prepare.

title: Residential Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Easterseals (West Orange, NJ) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process began with a telephone interview and then I was asked to submit a list of reference. After the reference check was complete, I was then asked to come in to the office for an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for a non-profit Behavioral Health Service corporation?

title: Clinical Training Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and easy process for being interviewed.
Interview Questions: What is something that I would like to learn or grow in to with working in this field?

title: Special Event Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Evansville, IN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was short/ brief. Not many questions that were out of the ordinary. The job description and what the actual job entailed were not the same. somewhat confusing.I wish that they would have talked more about what the actual job entailed. I should have asked why the others before me left. that would have been a good indicator.
Interview Questions: What's your biggest weakness?

title: Behavioral Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (Ontario, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a large hall filled with program managers. They sat down each interviewee individually and spent about 15 minutes with each one.They asked about 3 questions. They hire you on the spot.
Interview Questions: What is the worst situation you've been in during a session and how did you handle it?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Des Moines, IA)
Interview Descriptions: Odd interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Autism Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: It went fine. The recruiters were nice enough. The paperwork was a bit much. The ESBA HR department is disorganized and messed up my benefits and pay. It took months to resolve.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Behavioral Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The first part was in a group setting, The second part of the interview process was 1:1. Asking questions , doing some senario role play, & background check. They also gave our group a testing of our knowledge of ABA applied behavior analysis for working with children with autism .
Interview Questions: How many years experience do you have working with children with autism & special needs ?

title: Payroll Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (New Orleans, LA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough process, so be prepared.  Be honest and be yourself.  The HR and my future direct supervisor (the CFO) interviewed me, then there was an offer a week later.  I've seen them run a second set of interviews for similar positions, so be ready for that possibility.  Make sure your references are aware that they will be contacted!  verify their information and make sure it is current.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a full day at your previous job.

title: Employment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Lakewood, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Easy, applied online and went in for a interview.  Very casual here, most people are wearing jeans and a company polo shirt.  They lead you to believe that the job is more prestigious than it really is.  Many of the work sites are janitorial meaning you will literally be cleaning bathroom, conference rooms, etc along side the clients you work with.
Interview Questions: None were difficult

title: Employment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Lakewood, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Their hiring process is a joke. They will hire just about any person that walks through the door. You will meet with several different people and by the time you get to the last person they have nothing new to talk to you about. It is very laid-back and just about everyone you meet or talk with will be wearing jeans. They do not give you the best idea of what the job is going to entail so be sure you ask a lot of questions so that you get an idea for the position.
Interview Questions: There were no hard or unexpected questions. All very standard. They will ask about your past and how you can contribute to this job and if you have experience with the population.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: They have you fill out answers to a list of ABA terminologies (2 pages) before you actually go in to the interview. For me, it was one-on-one interview in a lobby where there were a lot of tables set up. They were interviewing a lot of people at once.
Interview Questions: Most unexpected was having to fill out the answers to the questions before the interview!

title: Personal Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Easterseals in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: The application process was unusual as there was no option to apply online. All applications submitted must be done via Fax, email or snail mail: you first need to access the application document on their website, which is a PDF format. You then you print it, fill it out, and either scan it and email it to HR, or fax it, or snail mail it.  The interview process was surprisingly short, only two interviews. The first with HR personnel which is your basic personality test, which I expected. The second interview is with the supervisor of whichever department you would be working in, plus a few other staff members. I expected this second interview to be more job-specific, but the majority of it was the same types of questions from the first interview: things like "tell me about a time when you disagreed with a co-worker, and how did you handle it?". In fact, at one point I actually was asked the exact same question from the first interview. The staff members who interviewed me, as well as the front desk staff who greeted me, were all very polite, professional and welcoming.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about a time where a strength of yours became a weakness?"

title: PM Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy. Few questions. Open ended. Overall process took about 30 minutes. Employee referral. Didn't take my resume. Liked the process. Requires minimal critical thinking skills. Very laid back process
Interview Questions: What would you do in ______scenario

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: At first I was interviewed over the phone by a recruiter for Easter Seals. The next interview was with a clinical Supervisor. Within 2 weeks after this second interview, I was hired.
Interview Questions: Can you please define ABA?

title: Autism Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: I had a positive phone interview experience with Easter Seals. The woman who interviewed me was very friendly and interested in talking to me about more than just the position which made me feel like I could have good rapport with the employees in the company. I declined a second interview because the position wasn't right for me.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were altogether difficult. The only thing that alarmed me was when they offered me an hourly rate of $18/hour. To me this seemed to be very low and I expressed that and was then asked what I thought an acceptable rate was. Unfortunately I didn't expect to talk salary during the phone interview though I'm glad we did because the low hourly rate is what ultimately convinced me that it wasn't the job for me.

title: Job Readiness Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Easterseals (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by Oscar Molina (Workforce Services, Midvale, Utah).  He told me that Easter Seals always needs someone and that the job pays minimum wage of $7.50 per hr.  He advised me to call Cindy Lehmann at Easter Seals.  I was hired immediately.   Mohamed Samatar helped me with the paperwork.
Interview Questions: No questions asked.

title: Early Intervention Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Peoria, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and got a call to come in for an interview.
The interview itself went really well (or so I thought). I left feeling very confident.
Most places say they'll call around a certain time with an answer whether it's a yes or a no, but none of them ever call.
This place actually called! However, it was to say they couldn't offer me a position at the time, but was wondering if I would still be interested later (in 2-3 months) because I was next in line of "wanted" candidates. They wanted to ask the state if they could hire a couple more people but they wouldn't know the answer until later. I told them that would all depend on if I had a job by then or not!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Employment Planning and Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very easy.  First, I had to submit my application online.  Then I was contacted by phone and a face to face interview was scheduled.  I interviewed with the Director of Adult Services and was informed within a couple of weeks that I had been chosen for the position.
Interview Questions: There were no real difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Program Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Easterseals in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with a senior clinical manager and the regional director.  The questions were standard. background info, knowledge of ABA, assessments, managing people, give an example of a time it didn't go well, how do you deal with challenging employee...
Interview Questions: The most challenging questions was how do you transition from being a coworker to a person's manager and what will you do to handle that and still remain profession

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was quick.  There was one interview where several people were hired and basically given a decision right away.  They seem to set up a limited amount if time for interviewing with the intention of hiring many people.  The whole interview process seemed rushed- good for someone who wants a job right away, bad for anyone looking to work for a company with standards.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about getting bit or spit on by a child?

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sent my application of interest to their Craigslist ad and then was invited to their hiring/interview day. Be sure to bring multiple copies of your resume with you just in case. Received an offer and had a second day to come in and hear more about the company and benefits that they offer and complete some paperwork.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot of scenario questions "What would you do if a participant did this?" and things like "Tell me about an experience that was really difficult for you and how you handled it?" etc.

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by three different people within an hour.
Interview Questions: The third person asked me to demonstrate how I would act out making a piece of paper interesting to gain a child's attention.

title: Special Education Paraprofessional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Easterseals (Tinley Park, IL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with the principal of the school and a teacher. I was taken on tour of the school and given information concerning the disabilities and diagnoses of the kids the school serves. After, I met some other members of support teams and clinical staff and given time to ask any questions.
Interview Questions: What could I bring to the agency

title: Intensive In Home Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: No interview process. I was their intern. I had to fill out a background check. I also had to do a application.. At the time other people from the office approach me for a Hab tech position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Sorrento, FL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial Communication is through their website first, then email to setup interview, Interview in person: I dressed up, was asked a series of simple What would you do in this scenario cases?, I was asked a question that was very difficult for me see below, I told them about myself and heard about them, after interview my references were called. Once they checked out I was called back in to pick up DT paperwork and background check paperwork. Then I was directed via email to be fingerprinted then to come back into the office after.  Once in the office we completed hiring paperwork both for the organization and the gov't. Work began.
Interview Questions: "What are you proud of?"

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Tucson, AZ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was quick, but informative. They asked me questions about previous employers, I got interviewed via phone by three people, they all talked at the same time, and it was quite hard to understand what exactly was being said, but when they made comments to each other, it could be heard.
Interview Questions: Why Social Work?

title: Job Placement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward and casual. The interview was mostly conversational. You were asked the basic interview questions as well as given situations and asked how you would respond to them.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: President/Chief Executive Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Easterseals (Auburn Hills, MI)
Interview Descriptions: HR interviews qualified candidates than passes on the candidate pool to the manager for final interview(s).
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses and how did you overcome them?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initially received a phone call for an interview date. Went to the office for the interview. Filled out a questionaire regarding ABA terminology, about 30 questions long. Next was the interview. I received an offer the same day of the interview.
Interview Questions: Most difficult or unexpected question was the ABA questionaire. Very time consuming, not enough room to fill in answers.

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (Covina, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held in a hall of some sort. You spoke with Clinical Supervisors individually, whom of which approved you as an employee and then brought you to Corey to speak with you about any other additional concerns.
Interview Questions:
1. Do you have any experience working with children with autism? Please describe your most difficult situation with a child. 

2. What are your experiences working with kid?

3. List two strengths.

4. Give one weakness.

title: Autism Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Easterseals (Oakland, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Was invited for an interview.  4 other candidates were there at the same time as me.  2 different people interviewed us, mostly asking why we wanted to work with the autism population.
Interview Questions: None, really.  But, they were keen on making sure you used "person first" language.  Which, I was already familiar with. Remember, person-first...in your other job interviews--not with E S B A.

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call back the next morning, literally at 7am, and the person immediately gave me a phone interview while i was essentially asleep. I did not even remember doing the phone interview nor what I said until I received a second phone call asking me to do an in-person interview. When I got there, I filled out a questionnaire about whether or not I knew various behavioral terms. There were 2 other candidates waiting with me. The interview was quite long and the questions were very broad and open-ended; for example, "Name a time when you learned the most". There was role-playing at the end, where the interviewer pretended to be a client, and i demonstrated how I would run the therapy session. Many questions were about my prior experience. I think half the interview was about prior experience.
Interview Questions: When was the last time you had a problem with someone. Not necessarily a client, maybe a supervisor for example. What was the result?

title: Family Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Easterseals
Interview Descriptions: Initially interviewed with Director and Lead Family Support Advocate, was called back within 48 hrs and followed up with an interview by Corporate office and was offered a job the same day to start work within 3 days. Interview was easy going but Director stated upfront that she has had issues with employees respecting her. Definately was mislead by the amount of the workload and the fact that the company had not been at 100% staffing in over 90 days.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to continue to work/ be professional even if you feel wronged or mistreated by myself or someoneone on the management team? Can you put personal feelings to the side?

title: Paraprofessional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I initially applied online then came in for the interview. They asked me about my experience and to tell a little bit about myself. The rest of the interview was just information given about the company and job description. They asked me if I felt comfortable with what I would be doing.
Interview Questions: There wasn't any difficult questions, it was one of the most laid back interviews Ive ever had.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Irvine, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a fast expedited process with many other applicants. A test was given and a face to face interview was completed. Felt the interview did a god job getting to know me and understanding my experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Lead Teacher Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Easterseals (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview 1st it was basically an introduction of the job. face to face they read off an question air 2 person interview very easy if you have a degree in education or have worked with children 1 lady was well knowledgeable about the company the other lady was a tag along she took a lot of notes
Interview Questions: easy all about what when and how to handle and situation dealing with parents staff and children.

title: Financial Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Easterseals in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and friendly. basically talked about the duties and the staff, the hours and vacation time as well as covering and back up for different areas. it was really simple.  I was given an offer and accepted the position. I went from temp to perm within a week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Easter Seals

title: Master Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Oklahoma City, OK) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Two-part, panel interview.  The child development center director, human resource director and CEO all participated.  They were warm and professional.  After the interview I was asked to provide additional references from individuals who worked with me in an educational setting (I had listed references that worked with me in a business office).
Interview Questions: What is your teaching style?

title: Permanency Specialist (Adoption Foster Care Case Manager) Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Easterseals (Joliet, IL) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Foster Care Program Supervisor in-person and discussed the position and my experience.  The process was smooth ad a informal.  The interview was a for a new position that she created and much of the discussion was describing the expectations and whether or not this would be a good fit for both of us.
Interview Questions:
Why are you seeking a change in employer?
What is your knowledge of adoptions/guardianships in foster care?
Tell me about your understanding of DCFS policy and procedures?
Describe your background in working with children with special needs?

title: Behavior Interventionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Easterseals (Fullerton, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was accessing the knowledge of the interviewee. title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Easterseals in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the job on craigslist, by sending my resume along with a coverletter. The very next day i recieved a call regarding an interview. The Director and the Assiant Director interview together. They alternate asking you questions, If they are liking you for the position, the interview can take be as long 60 min. If they dont like the way the interview is going they ask a specific question (which i havent figured out yet) and end the interview with 10-15 min.

If you make it throught the interview, they will ask you to come in for a working interview. you will go into the classroom and interact with the teachers and the children for about 45min. afterwards they will meet with you and ask how you felt about working in that classroom, and ask if you had anymore questions. After you leave, they will talk to the teachers and ask them if they think you're a good fit for the room or not, they will ask how you interacted with the children, etc. 

They check ALLl of your references, and if they cant get ahold of someone, it delays the whole process. If everythings checks out you could be hired within 3-5 days.
Interview Questions: How long do you plan on working here?
